Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Lateral antebrachial cutaneous neuropathy after steroid injection at lateral epicondyle .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Lateral antebrachial cutaneous neuropathy |

The disease entity in the paragraph is "Lateral antebrachial cutaneous neuropathy". It is a peripheral nerve disorder that affects the lateral antebrachial cutaneous nerve, which supplies sensation to the skin on the outer (lateral) side of the forearm. The condition can occur as a complication of steroid injections at the lateral epicondyle.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

| Lateral antebrachial cutaneous neuropathy |

The only disease entity in the paragraph is "Lateral antebrachial cutaneous neuropathy". The term "steroid injection" and "lateral epicondyle" are not considered diseases, but rather medical procedures and anatomical locations, respectively.

Explanation:

In the given paragraph, the only word that can be identified as a chemical entity is "steroid". A steroid is a type of organic compound that belongs to the class of lipids known as sterols and is characterized by a particular molecular structure consisting of four fused rings. Therefore, it is valid to list "steroid" as a chemical entity in this context.
